channel.title: Cannot reach class file(Packaging)
channel.description:
Hey!
I was looking at 'fixing NPC noclip' tutorial and I had two errors that I had a hard time with... They are -
[code].\server\npcs\NPC.java:7: cannot find symbol symbol : class Tile location: class server.npcs.NPC private Tile currentTile; ^ .\Server\Server.java:22: cannot access server.players.WalkingCheck bad class file: .\server\players\WalkingCheck.java file does not contain class server.players.WalkingCheck Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct subdirectory of the classpa th. WalkingCheck.check(); ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Now to make long ERROR(Not story :P) short, the class file cannot locate the other class file I'm trying to 'import,' NPC.java is in ./server/npc/, Tile.java is in ./server/players/. I never told the class file that 'in order to locate the class file, you must change directory,' which leads me to my question.
How can I make it so that the class file is able to locate a different class file that it outside the folder.
I'm sorry for my bad wording, it's hard to explain it, I personally thing that the batch file error is more explanatory than my two paragraphs ^^
Anyways, Thanks in advance! -Skullator

item.title: Cannot reach class file(Packaging)
item.dc:creator: @Skullator Skullator
item.description:
@Skullator wrote:

Hey!

I was looking at ‘fixing NPC noclip’ tutorial and I had two errors that I had a hard time with… They are -

.\server\npcs\NPC.java:7: cannot find symbol symbol : class Tile location: class server.npcs.NPC private Tile currentTile; ^ .\Server\Server.java:22: cannot access server.players.WalkingCheck bad class file: .\server\players\WalkingCheck.java file does not contain class server.players.WalkingCheck Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct subdirectory of the classpa th. WalkingCheck.check(); ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Now to make long ERROR(Not story :P) short, the class file cannot locate the other class file I’m trying to ‘import,’ NPC.java is in ./server/npc/, Tile.java is in ./server/players/. I never told the class file that ‘in order to locate the class file, you must change directory,’ which leads me to my question.

How can I make it so that the class file is able to locate a different class file that it outside the folder.

I’m sorry for my bad wording, it’s hard to explain it, I personally thing that the batch file error is more explanatory than my two paragraphs ^^

Anyways,
Thanks in advance!
-Skullator
